en-US.1-details:
Uses User-Agent to identify the model
In this example it is located under 'platform'
Mozilla/5.0 ('system-information') 'platform' ('platform-details') 'extensions'
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/User-Agent
en-US.2-details:
Uses User-Agent to identify the OS
In this example it is located under 'extensions'
Mozilla/5.0 ('system-information') 'platform' ('platform-details') 'extensions'
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/User-Agent
en-US.3-details:
Uses User-Agent to identify the OS
In this example it is located under 'extensions'
Mozilla/5.0 ('system-information') 'platform' ('platform-details') 'extensions'
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/User-Agent
en-US.4-details:
Uses getFeature() to identify the amount of RAM
navigator.getFeature ('hardware.memory')
Source: https://wiki.mozilla.org/WebAPI/Navigator.hasFeature
en-US.5-details:
Uses getFeature() to identify the Developer Mode status
navigator.getFeature ('dom.apps.developer_mode')
Source: https://kaios.dev/2024/01/complete-feature-detection-on-kaios/

en-US.1-details:
Uses Window: screen property to identify the resolution
window.screen.width and window.screen.height
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen
en-US.2-details:
Uses Window: screen property to identify the color depth
window.screen.colorDepth
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen
en-US.3-details:
Uses screen's width and height to calculate ratio
commonDivisor = gcd(window.screen.width, window.screen.height); ratioWidth = window.screen.width / commonDivisor; ratioHeight = window.screen.height / commonDivisor;
en-US.4-details:
Uses Window: screen property to identify the screen orientation
window.screen.mozOrientation or window.screen.orientation.type
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Screen

en-US.1-details:
Uses Navigator: hardwareConcurrency property to identify the amount of cores
navigator.hardwareConcurrency
Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/hardwareConcurrency
en-US.2-details: Estimates the cpu frequency by using for loops and Performance: now() method <text class='link'> Source: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/now</text>

en-US.1-details-description: Uses navigator.mozCameras's getCamera('identifier') method to access the camera, then it reads camera.id to identify the id
en-US.1-details-example: cameraList = navigator .mozCameras .getListOfCameras(); camera = navigator .mozCameras .getCamera(camerasList[index]) id = camera.camera.id
en-US.2-details-description: Uses navigator.mozCameras's getListOfCameras() method to get camera names
en-US.3-details-description: Uses navigator.mozCameras's getCamera('identifier') method to access the camera, then it reads camera.capabilities.width and height
en-US.4-details-description: Uses navigator.mozCameras's getCamera('identifier') method to access the camera, then it reads camera.focalLength to identify the focal length
en-US.4-details-example: cameraList = navigator .mozCameras .getListOfCameras(); camera = navigator .mozCameras .getCamera(camerasList[index]) focal = camera.camera.focalLength
